content: *original and best…* the classic granny square works wonderfully to create a patchwork effect in this beautiful vintage style blanket that could be straight from granny s attic **pattern notes** a full written pattern for my classic grannie square together with joining information and border instructions **skill level** *beginner* a great next step on from the classic granny square a simple blanket and border using basic stitches and a decreasing stitch **yarn** 23 balls of stylecraft special dk in 17 colours 100g / 322 yards 294 m 100% acrylic dk/8ply yarn 1 ball each of aster 1003 cloud blue 1023 raspberry 1023 copper 1029 teal 1062 mocha 1064 meadow 1065 grape 1067 soft peach 1240 gold 1709 storm blue 1722 2 balls each of sherbert 1034 pale rose 1080 claret 1123 shrimp 1132 silver 1203 sage 1725 *yarn substitutions* for a similar sized blanket you ll need approximately 7000 yards of your own choice of dk yarn this pattern can be made in any weight of yarn just use the appropriate hook size and remember that your yardage requirements will vary **hook** 4mm g usa **materials** yarn needle **size** 178 x 188cm 71 x 75 **gauge** 6 5cm 2 5 per square **pattern includes ** * a full and clearly written pattern * full photo tutorial for the border available linked * links to more useful photo tutorials * full colour breakdown with layout **pattern written in ** uk terms us terms **cherry heart s cozy corner** please come and join the cherry heart group 2 watch podcasts join crochet/knit alongs share your projects and enjoy yarny chit chat **show me your project** #cherryheart 1 http //www cherryheart co uk/2016/03/granny-patches html 2 http //www ravelry com/groups/cherry-hearts-cozy-corner
